definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: I needed to travel or volunteer or take an unpaid internship.
sentences.chinese: 我需要去旅行，做志愿者或者去做无薪实习生。

sentences.english: Businesses might inquire interns to receive college credit for their experience.
sentences.chinese: 有些公司会要求实习生出示学校给的信用证明。

sentences.english: Kitchens will be staffed by a base of full-time chefs together with a stream of trainee chefs on work experience.
sentences.chinese: 厨房将配备专职厨师，还有一些实习生。

sentences.english: Some luxury companies recruit for sales trainees at China's top universities.
sentences.chinese: 部分奢侈品公司在中国最好的大学中招募销售实习生。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the effectiveness of pre-job training on nursing interns.
sentences.chinese: 目的对护理实习生岗前培训效果进行探讨。

sentences.english: Does Wuhan have advertizing company recruit the graphic designing probationer's?
sentences.chinese: 武汉哪有广告公司招平面设计实习生的？

sentences.english: Do you have a team of writers and project managers, or you and an intern?
sentences.chinese: 你是否有写手和项目经理，还是你和一个实习生？

sentences.english: Most chores and hard work were done by the apprentices.
sentences.chinese: 所有例行的工作或者是粗活大都是由实习生来完成。

sentences.english: “Nothing much for us to do, ” the intern said grimly.
sentences.chinese: “我们根本无能为力了，”实习生伤感地说道。

sentences.english: Merrill has also revitalised its trainee programme, it said.
sentences.chinese: 美林表示，公司还重新启动了实习生计划。

sentences.english: How to apply for a job or internship with Sensata China?
sentences.chinese: 如何申请森萨塔中国制造的实习生职位？

sentences.english: This is Mr. Long, one of the new management trainees.
sentences.chinese: 这位是朗先生，新来的企管实习生。

sentences.english: She asks interns to commit 30 hours a week;
sentences.chinese: 法利斯要求实习生每周工作30个小时。

sentences.english: But five medical trainees stood behind me.
sentences.chinese: 但是五个实习生还站在我旁边。

sentences.english: As for Kravis, his firm doesn't employ summer interns.
sentences.chinese: 至于克拉维斯，他的公司不雇用夏季实习生。

sentences.english: You worked as an intern for a private detective as well.
sentences.chinese: 你还在一家私人侦探所当过实习生。

definition: to learn on the job/to be on probation
(publishing) (abbr. for 美術編輯|美术编辑[mei3 shu4 bian1 ji2]) layout and graphics/graphic design/art editor/graphic designer
editor in charge (abbr. for 責任編輯|责任编辑[ze2 ren4 bian1 ji2])
Li Peng (1928-), leading PRC politician, prime minister 1987-1998, reportedly leader of the conservative faction advocating the June 1989 Tiananmen clampdown
morning newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Morning Post
